work.summary: I was tasked with keeping pool patrons safe and enforcing pool rules, while maintaining a Lifeguard skillset including but not limited to, CPR and First Aid and a professional attitude on the pool deck.  I had to work with 2-3 other lifeguards and even alone during evening hours to make sure the pool ran by the standards that were set for us.
highlights: I was able to apply the training I received in a real life scenario.
Firsthand experience working with a team to keep people's lives safe.

work.summary: I was required to work with a team of different individuals during various Track and Field events to ensure that each event ran smoothly and was as fair as possible to all the competitors.  I either to keep track of one competitor or a team of competitors during the 100-meter dash or 400-meter relay.
highlights: The times I recorded would ultimately be used to determine the winners for each event, so to ensure fairness, so I had to be spot on when timing.
I gained valuable and humbling experience when interacting with different types of people due to the nature of the Special Olympics.

awards.title: Eagle Scout
awards.summary: Eagle Scout is the highest achievement or rank attainable in the Boy Scouting program of the Boy Scouts of America. The designation 'Eagle Scout' was founded over one hundred years ago. Only four percent of Boy Scouts are granted this rank after a lengthy review process.
